alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Tippecanoe; White (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 9:42PM EST until January 29 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...Illinois... White River from Edwardsport to Hazleton Wabash River from Lafayette to Riverton East Fork White River at Seymour. Tippecanoe River near Delphi. Wildcat Creek near Lafayette. .Lowland flooding continues along much of the Wabash River, from Lafayette down to Riverton. There is potential for flooding to develop later in the week at Vincennes and Mount Carmel. The crest is past Lafayette and should reach Covington by mid-morning Monday. The rives are rising at all locations. Flooding may last as long as Tuesday, February 6. Lowland flooding is either expected to develop or may develop on the lower White River by Monday night from about Edwardsport downstream to the Hazleton area. Flooding could last as long as Wednesday afternoon. Additional flooding is ongoing on the East Fork White at Seymour and tributaries of the upper Wabash. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tippecanoe River near Delphi. * WHEN...From late tonight to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Low agricultural lands, river parks and a few local roads flood along the Tippecanoe River. Oakdale Public Access Site flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EST Sunday the stage was 7.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Monday afternoon by around 1245 PM EST /1145 AM CST/.
